- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Selecting and entering a repository from the repository explorer and then going back to the repository explorer causes the page position to jump back to top and not at the last position before entering the repository.  This makes it hard to find the previous position again.  

Example in iOS shown but the same is experienced on other platforms

### Reproduction steps

1.Open HACS in Home Assistant
2.Select "+" or "Explore and Download Repositories".
3.Scroll down to any repository
4. Enter repository
5. Go back by pressuing "<-"
6. Position will return to top and not to last position prior to entering the repository
...


### Screenshots


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63410825/200134208-d7738726-c186-45e2-8727-d5f2e22fbb03.mov



### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text

A 'cache-control' header is missing or empty.
Resource should use cache busting but URL does not match configured patterns.
Static resources should use a 'cache-control' header with 'max-age=31536000' or more.
Static resources should use a 'cache-control' header with the 'immutable' directive.
Security
Response should include 'x-content-type-options' header.
The 'Expires' header should not be used, 'Cache-Control' should be preferred.
The 'server' header should only contain the server name.
Other

```

_No response_

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have enabled debug logging for my installation.
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the backend (integration part) of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Each time I try and add any custom repo from github I receive the error - Repository structure for v4.24.0 is not compliant

This has only started to happen recently in the last couple of weeks.

### Reproduction steps

1. Explore & Download Repositories
2. Click the 3 dots
3. Custom Repositories
4. Paste link from github repo
5. Select Category
6. Select Add

![Untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70321584/197488939-2cf00e4f-7a38-4ad0-bd5d-36ae1fb116aa.png)


### Debug logs

```text
I have the hacs debug logging set up in my configuration.yaml but can't locate where the logs are as the documentation doesn't state the location and I've looked in HA logs drop down but HACS is not an option.
```


### Diagnostics dump

[config_entry-hacs-195264a99441d6c595e411f45571b6e8.json.txt](https://github.com/hacs/integration/files/9850336/config_entry-hacs-195264a99441d6c595e411f45571b6e8.json.txt)

### Describe the issue

hacks does not load cards after a reboot and HA is offline (no internet). If the host lost power and after a restore hacs no longer loads-up the installed cards. The internet connection to HA needs to be restored in order for hacs to load the cards.

### Reproduction steps

1. Stop the internet connection to Home assistant
2. Reboot host or restart Home assistant
3. Upon HA restart hacs display a message of a number of cards no being loaded. The frontend cards are all red
4. Upon restoring the internet connection the cards are properly loaded
5.
...

issue.title: /hacsfiles/ isn't accessible after adding integration until hass is restarted.
issue.body:
### Describe the issue

It seems like Home Assistant needs to be restarted after adding the HACS integration if you want to use HACS for front end components, but I don't see a mention of that on `https://hacs.xyz/docs/configuration/basic` 

In two recent installations against 2022.10.x, I noticed after adding the HACS integration, HACS seems to work, but adding and trying to use front end components won't work yet because `/hacsfiles/` returns a 404 until after Home Assistant is restarted.  Once restarted a `403: Forbidden` is returned, indicating that it recognizes it as a directory.

I'm guessing this would only trip up someone who wants to add front end components and use them right away.  If you add an integration, you need to restart hass anyway, so you'd never notice this.

### Screenshots

```
$ curl -i http://...:8123/hacsfiles/
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 14
Date: Sun, 16 Oct 2022 22:26:16 GMT
Server: Python/3.10 aiohttp/3.8.1
```

### Describe the issue

This issue is cosmetic.

The alphabetic sort feature of downloaded repositories requires one mouse click to go from `a to z` to `z to a`, but two to go from `z to a` back to `a to z`.

### Reproduction steps

See issue.

chrome

Bump pyhiveapi to 0.5.14 ([@KJonline](https://github.com/KJonline) - [#79530](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/pull/79530)) ([hive docs](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/hive/)) (dependency)

### Checklist

- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>

- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

I'm not able to find the HACS integration in the list of integrations in the Home Assistant web UI. 

I'm running in a HA docker container on a Synology NAS after following the instructions here: https://www.home-assistant.io/installation/alternative/#synology-nas

I've installed HACS following the steps here: https://hacs.xyz/docs/setup/download/ with a modification to the script to replace unzip with 7z (per instructions here: https://www.reddit.com/user/j9111/ ). 

Those instructions were wrong, and I ended up unzipping it manually and now I can find the integration. 

The installation script could fail over to 7z if it doesn't find unzip, as it appears to be the utility available on this NAS. 

The installation script could also check for the existence of the files at the end of the process, to be sure that the thing actually worked?

### Reproduction steps

1. Try to run the installation script on a system without unzip
2. Try to find the integration in the list in the HA web UI and fail. 
3.
...

### Debug logs

```text
Github says I can't put it here 'cos it exceeds 65535 characters. I'll attach a file instead.

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>

- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

Selecting and entering a repository from the repository explorer and then going back to the repository explorer causes the page position to jump back to top and not at the last position before entering the repository.  This makes it hard to find the previous position again.  

Example in iOS shown but the same is experienced on other platforms

### Reproduction steps

1.Open HACS in Home Assistant
2.Select "+" or "Explore and Download Repositories".
3.Scroll down to any repository
4. Enter repository
5. Go back by pressuing "<-"
6. Position will return to top and not to last position prior to entering the repository
...


### Screenshots


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63410825/200134208-d7738726-c186-45e2-8727-d5f2e22fbb03.mov

issue.body:

### Describe the issue

hacks does not load cards after a reboot and HA is offline (no internet). If the host lost power and after a restore hacs no longer loads-up the installed cards. The internet connection to HA needs to be restored in order for hacs to load the cards.

### Reproduction steps

1. Stop the internet connection to Home assistant
2. Reboot host or restart Home assistant
3. Upon HA restart hacs display a message of a number of cards no being loaded. The frontend cards are all red
4. Upon restoring the internet connection the cards are properly loaded
5.
...


### Debug logs

```text
N/A
```

N/A

issue.title: /hacsfiles/ isn't accessible after adding integration until hass is restarted.
issue.body:
### Describe the issue

It seems like Home Assistant needs to be restarted after adding the HACS integration if you want to use HACS for front end components, but I don't see a mention of that on `https://hacs.xyz/docs/configuration/basic` 

In two recent installations against 2022.10.x, I noticed after adding the HACS integration, HACS seems to work, but adding and trying to use front end components won't work yet because `/hacsfiles/` returns a 404 until after Home Assistant is restarted.  Once restarted a `403: Forbidden` is returned, indicating that it recognizes it as a directory.

I'm guessing this would only trip up someone who wants to add front end components and use them right away.  If you add an integration, you need to restart hass anyway, so you'd never notice this.

### Screenshots

```
$ curl -i http://...:8123/hacsfiles/
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 14
Date: Sun, 16 Oct 2022 22:26:16 GMT
Server: Python/3.10 aiohttp/3.8.1
```

### Describe the issue

On opening HACS today I noticed the new interface(which I don't particularly like). I saw in the Release Notes for the latest update that a new interface was made available to those with Experimental Features enabled. I checked in the HACS integration options and saw I had this ticked. I unticked, and returned to HACS but still got the new interface. I reloaded the integration, but still got new interface. I restarted HA but still getting new HACS interface.
I checked on my laptop, and I see the old view, but on my Android, I still see the different view. I've force restarted the HA Companion App.

1. Disable Experimental Features
2. Reload HACS integration
3. Restart HACS
4. Force stop HA Companion App

### Describe the issue

When selecting the 'Explore and Download Repositories' button, then when on the Home Assistant Community Store - Explore page selecting the 3 dots then 'Custom Repositories, nothing happens. There is nowhere to add the custom repository link like there was before.

I have tried on Google Chrome and Safari and via the Home Assistant Companion app but with the same result.

### Reproduction steps

1.  Select HACS
2.  Select Explore and Download Repositories
3.  Home Assistant Community Store - Explore opens
4.  Select the 3 menu dots
5. Select Custom Repositories
6. No popup for custom link
...

### Describe the issue

I'm not able to find the HACS integration in the list of integrations in the Home Assistant web UI. 

I'm running in a HA docker container on a Synology NAS after following the instructions here: https://www.home-assistant.io/installation/alternative/#synology-nas

I've installed HACS following the steps here: https://hacs.xyz/docs/setup/download/ with a modification to the script to replace unzip with 7z (per instructions here: https://www.reddit.com/user/j9111/ ). 

Those instructions were wrong, and I ended up unzipping it manually and now I can find the integration. 

The installation script could fail over to 7z if it doesn't find unzip, as it appears to be the utility available on this NAS. 

The installation script could also check for the existence of the files at the end of the process, to be sure that the thing actually worked?

1. Try to run the installation script on a system without unzip

### Describe the issue

Selecting and entering a repository from the repository explorer and then going back to the repository explorer causes the page position to jump back to top and not at the last position before entering the repository.  This makes it hard to find the previous position again.  

Example in iOS shown but the same is experienced on other platforms

### Reproduction steps

1.Open HACS in Home Assistant
2.Select "+" or "Explore and Download Repositories".
3.Scroll down to any repository
4. Enter repository
5. Go back by pressuing "<-"
6. Position will return to top and not to last position prior to entering the repository
...


### Screenshots


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63410825/200134208-d7738726-c186-45e2-8727-d5f2e22fbb03.mov

- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

hacks does not load cards after a reboot and HA is offline (no internet). If the host lost power and after a restore hacs no longer loads-up the installed cards. The internet connection to HA needs to be restored in order for hacs to load the cards.

### Reproduction steps

1. Stop the internet connection to Home assistant
2. Reboot host or restart Home assistant
3. Upon HA restart hacs display a message of a number of cards no being loaded. The frontend cards are all red
4. Upon restoring the internet connection the cards are properly loaded
5.
...


### Debug logs

```text
N/A
```


### Diagnostics dump

N/A

issue.title: /hacsfiles/ isn't accessible after adding integration until hass is restarted.
issue.body:
### Describe the issue

It seems like Home Assistant needs to be restarted after adding the HACS integration if you want to use HACS for front end components, but I don't see a mention of that on `https://hacs.xyz/docs/configuration/basic` 

In two recent installations against 2022.10.x, I noticed after adding the HACS integration, HACS seems to work, but adding and trying to use front end components won't work yet because `/hacsfiles/` returns a 404 until after Home Assistant is restarted.  Once restarted a `403: Forbidden` is returned, indicating that it recognizes it as a directory.

I'm guessing this would only trip up someone who wants to add front end components and use them right away.  If you add an integration, you need to restart hass anyway, so you'd never notice this.

### Screenshots

```
$ curl -i http://...:8123/hacsfiles/
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 14
Date: Sun, 16 Oct 2022 22:26:16 GMT
Server: Python/3.10 aiohttp/3.8.1
```

### Checklist

- [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS <https://github.com/hacs/integration/releases/latest>
- [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability.
- [X] I have read <https://hacs.xyz/docs/issues>
- [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS.
- [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue).
- [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext).

### Describe the issue

On opening HACS today I noticed the new interface(which I don't particularly like). I saw in the Release Notes for the latest update that a new interface was made available to those with Experimental Features enabled. I checked in the HACS integration options and saw I had this ticked. I unticked, and returned to HACS but still got the new interface. I reloaded the integration, but still got new interface. I restarted HA but still getting new HACS interface.
I checked on my laptop, and I see the old view, but on my Android, I still see the different view. I've force restarted the HA Companion App.

### Reproduction steps

1. Disable Experimental Features
2. Reload HACS integration
3. Restart HACS
4. Force stop HA Companion App



### Screenshots

### Javascript logs from your browser console

```text
Not accessible in HA Companion App
```


### Diagnostics dump

_No response_

issue.title: Integration can not be removed ("unknown_command")
issue.body:
### Web browser Firefox (also tried other browsers, HA Companion app on iOS etc.) ### Web browser version 105.0.3 ### System Health details I don't have that copy button according to https://www.home-assistant.io//more-info/system-health#github-issues yet (HA Core 2022.6.7), therefore this way: Version | core-2022.6.7 -- | -- Installationstyp | Home Assistant OS Entwicklung | false Supervisor | true Docker | true Benutzer | root Virtuelle Umgebung | false Python-Version | 3.9.12 Betriebssystemfamilie | Linux Betriebssystem-Version | 5.15.61-v8 CPU-Architektur | aarch64 Zeitzone | Europe/Berlin

Home Assistant Community Store

GitHub API | ok -- | -- GitHub Content | ok GitHub Web | ok GitHub API Calls Remaining | 4973 Installed Version | 1.26.2 Stage | running Available Repositories | 1187 Downloaded Repositories | 82 ### Checklist - [X] I'm running the newest version of HACS - [X] I have filled out the issue template to the best of my ability. - [X] I have read - [X] This issue is related to the frontend of HACS. - [X] This issue only contains 1 issue (if you have multiple issues, open one issue for each issue). - [X] This issue is not a duplicate issue of currently [open](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues) or issues [pending release](https://github.com/hacs/integration/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+sort%3Aupdated-desc+milestone%3Anext). ### Describe the issue A specific integration (ShellyForHASS) can not be removed using the UI. When clicking the remove/uninstall button, nothing happens: ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13799156/195640902-669c5253-0cbe-4c91-bbff-0c37b7136a35.png) The browser logs this error on every click at remove/uninstall: (see "Javascript logs from your browser console" section below) See also https://github.com/StyraHem/ShellyForHASS/issues/712 (one month and no reaction at all - that's one of many reasons I need to urgently remove this custom integration!). ### Describe the issue

When the list of integrations is loading, scrolling to the end before it's loaded additional entries makes the window unscrollable until closed (with the still responsive close button) and reopened.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18318249/194806356-8d5a770b-99c3-4bfc-9441-9b54cfc22662.mp4

### Reproduction steps

1. Open HACS Integration browser
2. Hard scroll in window

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18318249/194806550-66c2de80-255a-46c0-b00d-91e68c0e6da5.mp4

### Describe the issue

I'm not able to find the HACS integration in the list of integrations in the Home Assistant web UI. 

I'm running in a HA docker container on a Synology NAS after following the instructions here: https://www.home-assistant.io/installation/alternative/#synology-nas

I've installed HACS following the steps here: https://hacs.xyz/docs/setup/download/ with a modification to the script to replace unzip with 7z (per instructions here: https://www.reddit.com/user/j9111/ ). 

Those instructions were wrong, and I ended up unzipping it manually and now I can find the integration. 

The installation script could fail over to 7z if it doesn't find unzip, as it appears to be the utility available on this NAS. 

The installation script could also check for the existence of the files at the end of the process, to be sure that the thing actually worked?

1. Try to run the installation script on a system without unzip
